metadata.Title: CVE-2014-0039 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Untrusted search path vulnerability in fwsnort before 1.6.4, when not running as root, allows local users to execute arbitrary code via a Trojan horse fwsnort.conf in the current working directory.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-0039` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

fwsnort - 1.6.4-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: fwsnort package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.6.4-1').
